title: Simple harmonic motion - calculate spring constant

content.question: A block of mass <math alttext="0.40 kilograms" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.40</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>kg</mtext></math> attached to a horizontal spring is undergoing simple harmonic motion along a horizontal surface. The maximum acceleration of the block has a magnitude of <math alttext="1.5 meters per second squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1.5</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><msup><mtext>m/s</mtext><mn>2</mn></msup></math> and occurs when the block is displaced by a distance of <math alttext="0.20 meters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.20</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></math> from its equilibrium position. The spring constant of the spring is most nearly

choices.label: <math alttext="0.12 newtons per meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>0.12</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>N/m</mtext></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="0.60 newtons per meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>0.60</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>N/m</mtext></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="3.0 newtons per meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>3.0</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>N/m</mtext></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="7.5 newtons per meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>7.5</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>N/m</mtext></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="3.0 newtons per meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>3.0</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>N/m</mtext></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
